newsitem.title: UK: UK seen turning to City for London Transport funds.
newsitem.headline: UK seen turning to City for London Transport funds.

text.p: UK's Deputy Prime Minister and transport head John Prescott could turn to London's financial community to raise up to two billion stg through a special bond issue to fund repairs to London Transport, the Times said on Monday.
The newspaper quoted a spokeman for the Department of Transport as saying, "The Government is looking at all options."

One alternative is that investment banks in London could issue bonds. Another is that London Transport could operate a trust through which public and private funding is channelled, the paper said. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
